subdisciplines.name: Physical Optics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the fundamental principles of optics, including the wave nature of light, interference, diffraction, polarization, and scattering.

subdisciplines.name: Geometrical Optics
subdisciplines.description: The study of light as rays and how they interact with different materials and shapes of objects.

subdisciplines.name: Applied Optics
subdisciplines.description: The application of optical principles to design and construct instruments and systems for practical use.

subdisciplines.name: Quantum Optics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the behavior of light and its interactions with matter at the level of individual particles such as atoms and photons.

subdisciplines.name: Nonlinear Optics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the behavior of light in materials that exhibit nonlinear optical properties, including harmonic generation, self-focusing, and the optical Kerr effect.
